question: Which country houses the "Mont Blanc Tramway"?
explanation: Mont Blanc Tramway is a 12.4-kilometer long mountain railway line, opened in 1907, located in the Haute-Savoie department of France. It is the highest railway line in France and the fourth-highest in Europe. The extensive views of Mont Blanc and adjacent mountains of Mont Blanc massif provided by the tramway make it a popular tourist attraction of France.
